name: Shivangi Srivastava
position: JPMorgan Chase & Co. | ISB | IIT Kharagpur '22
about: I am a Final Year Undergraduate student at IIT Kharagpur from the department of Mechanical Engineering pursuing a minor in Computer Science Engineering.

positions.subtitle: Technology Robotix Society
positions.description: Technology Robotix Society is the hub of all activities related to robotics at IIT Kharagpur and fast becoming the nerve center of Robotics in India.As a Head  of the society I contributed in the following fields:- Launched Makerspace Lab  â€“ an umbrella lab for robotics enthusiasts seeking mentor-ship, advanced components and infrastructure- Responsible for designing a Computer Vision event which was held at Kshitij 2019, Asiaâ€™s largest techno-management fest- Conducted technical workshops across India to spread the culture of robotics- Lead a 3-tier team of 34 people and ensured the successful execution of ROBOTIX events in Kshitij 2020- Organised weekly lectures on Image Processing for over 300 students throughout the academic year along with workshops and hackathons in my college
positions.title: Head
positions.description_html:
Technology Robotix Society is the hub of all activities related to robotics at IIT Kharagpur and fast becoming the nerve center of Robotics in India.

As a Head of the society I contributed in the following fields:

- Launched Makerspace Lab â€“ an umbrella lab for robotics enthusiasts seeking mentor-ship, advanced components and infrastructure
- Responsible for designing a Computer Vision event which was held at Kshitij 2019, Asiaâ€™s largest techno-management fest
- Conducted technical workshops across India to spread the culture of robotics
- Lead a 3-tier team of 34 people and ensured the successful execution of ROBOTIX events in Kshitij 2020
- Organised weekly lectures on Image Processing for over 300 students throughout the academic year along with workshops and hackathons in my college

experience.title: Research Intern
experience.description: - Worked on creating a model to predict the future EPS of firms using their previous Financial Data and Macro-Economic Factors- Successfully executed a Time Series Model and obtained an r2 score of 0.72, the model beat approximately 28% of the analysts- Additionally, implemented Trading Strategies like Piotroskiâ€™s F Score, G Score, PEAD, Betting against Beta, Accruals and Momentum- Analysed and implemented the Fama and French Four Factor model to test the validity of the trading strategies implemented above

experience.title: Research Intern
